oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Renfro Valley Gatherin' - 1954-02-07
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Renfro Valley Gatherin' program, 1954-02-07, parts 1 and 2, as recorded by WLAC (Nashville, Tenn.) Featuring announcer Ken Meeker, host John Lair, and performers Rural and Flossie [unconfirmed], as well as other unidentified performers. A CBS syndication originating at WHAS (Louisville, Ky.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Opening statement (Ken Meeker) -- Opening theme [Take Me Back To Renfro Valley] -- Opening statement (John Lair) -- John Lair dedicates the program to Abraham Lincoln and introduces the next tune -- How Tedious And Tasteless The Hours (all) -- Postum commercial (John Lair) -- I'm A Pilgrim (Rural and Flossie) [unconfirmed] -- John Lair reads off the list of birthdays -- Lair talks about the Renfro Valley Bugle, his book, and some history about Abraham Lincoln -- Rock Me To Sleep Mother ([Unidentified]) -- John Lair talks more about Lincoln and introduces the next tune -- Twenty Years Ago ([Unidentified]) -- Skip To My Lou (incomplete) -- Skip To My Lou (incomplete) -- Oh Sister Phoebe (all) -- John Lair talks -- When Adam Was Created ([Unidentified]) (incomplete) -- Lair talks -- Gentle Annie ([Unidentified]) -- Lair talks -- [Unidentified tune] -- Lair talks -- [Unidentified tune] -- Lair talks more about Lincoln -- Rock Me To Sleep Mother ([Unidentified]) -- Bran Flakes commercial (Lair)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WLAC (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Renfro Valley Gathering (Radio program); WHAS (Radio station : Louisville, Ky.); Meeker, Ken (Announcer); Lair, John;
